name: Path N Vagina
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of an inguinal lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes; a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO classifies such cases as pNX). (1)

**Note 2:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).  

**Note 3:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, record the code with regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage III is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Upper two thirds of vagina, regional nodes: 
       Pelvic lymph nodes:
           Iliac, NOS:
              Common
              External
               Internal (hypogastric)
                   Obturator
                   Middle sacral (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
       Pelvic lymph node(s), NOS

    Lower third of vagina, regional nodes:
       Ipsilateral or bilateral:
          Inguinal, NOS:
             Superficial inguinal (femoral)
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 204
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically: No regional lymph node metastasis
Use only for TNM defined pTis cases where there is a resection of the primary and the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
